Info Source: Taken from the Federal Railroad Administration's FY2004 safety penalty report obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request. A copy is available upon request.

Notes: Source document obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request to the agency.

Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: Total Fina S.A., Total Minatome Corporation, Total Exploration Production USA Inc., Fina Oil and Chemical Company, Elf Exploration Inc., Total E&P USA Inc. and their affiliates agreed to pay the United States $15 million to resolve claims that the companies violated the False Claims Act by knowingly underpaying royalties owed on natural gas produced from federal and Indian leases.

Company: Total Gas & Power North America, Inc.

Description: Total Petrochemical USA Inc. agreed to pay a $2.9 million penalty and spend $37 million to upgrade pollution controls at its Port Arthur, Texas, refinery to resolve alleged violations of the Clean Air Act.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division

Description: Total Petrochemical USA Inc. agreed to pay an $8.75 million penalty for failing to comply with the terms of a 2007 settlement with the United States that resolved alleged violations of the Clean Air Act at its Port Arthur, Texas, refinery.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Description: A settlement announced between the U.S. and Total Petroleum Puerto Rico Corp. resolved Resource Conservation Recovery Act (RCRA) violations alleged at 31 gas stations in Puerto Rico and four gas stations in the U.S. Virgin Islands that contain underground storage tanks (USTs) owned by Total Puerto Rico. Total Puerto Rico agreed to pay a $426,000 civil penalty, implement compliance measures valued at approximately $1 million and undertake a supplemental environmental project (SEP) consisting of a centralized monitoring system estimated to cost approximately $600,000.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Description: Total, S.A. agreed to pay a $245.2 million monetary penalty to resolve charges related to violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act in connection with payments made through third parties to a government official in Iran to obtain valuable oil and gas concessions.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
